_header: In a morning of May as I lay on sleeping
Note: Cf. 500 for another fragment which some think is the end of this work.
Title(s): Dialogue between a Nightingale and a Clerk
Subjects: debates, bird; birds, as narrators; women, against
_description: Dialogue between a Nightingale and a Clerk — 26 couplets plus one line

CULFf548.First Lines:
In a mornyng of may as I lay on slepyngTo here a song of a fowle
                    Ihad gret likyng…
CULFf548.Last Lines:
…but a man may change hir mote if his prise wey
                    greteNyȝtyngale þu gabbist me and þat is shame
                    thyne…
